Class CaesarCipher

java.lang.Object
CaesarCipher
public class CaesarCipher extends Object
This class implements a Caesar cipher with a fixed shift specified per object at construction time. Cipher objects can then translate a String or a single character as required.
Author:
Burhan Khan

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CaesarCipher(int requiredCipherShift)
    Constructs a cipher with the given shift.

  • Constructor Details

    • CaesarCipher

      public CaesarCipher(int requiredCipherShift)
      Constructs a cipher with the given shift. Any value outside the range 0 to 25 is converted using modulo 26.
      Parameters:
      requiredCipherShift - The shift to be used for this cipher.

  • Method Details

    • getCipherShift

      public int getCipherShift()
      Yields the cipher shift of this cipher.
      Returns:
      The shift used for this cipher.

    • incrementShift

      public CaesarCipher incrementShift()
      Constructs a new CaesarCipher with a cipher shift which is one greater (modulo 26) than that used for this cipher.
      Returns:
      The new CaesarCipher.

    • decrementShift

      public CaesarCipher decrementShift()
      Constructs a new CaesarCipher with a cipher shift which is one less (modulo 26) than that used for this cipher.
      Returns:
      The new CaesarCipher.

    • translate

      public String translate(String message)
      Translates a string.
      Parameters:
      message - The string to be translated.
      Returns:
      The translated message.

    • translate

      public char translate(char aChar)
      Tranlsates a single character. If it is a letter it is shifted within its alphabet (i.e upper or lower case). If it is not a letter, it is return unchanged.
      Parameters:
      aChar - The character to be translated.
      Returns:
      The translated character.
